summary_points: 1. At Cencora, Inc.'s 2025 Annual Meeting on March 6, 2025,  shareholder votes resulted in the election of all nine director nominees, but Lon R. Greenberg received significantly less support (15,673,799 votes against) than others.
2.  The advisory vote to approve the compensation of named executive officers passed with 156,885,713 votes for, but still attracted considerable opposition (12,269,867 votes against).

3. Ernst & Young LLP's appointment as Cencora, Inc.'s independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2025 was ratified by shareholders,  receiving 166,297,099 votes in favor against 12,410,706 votes against.

1. On March 10, 2025, Bank of New York Mellon Corp issued 500,000 depositary shares, each representing a 1/100th interest in a share of its Series J Noncumulative Perpetual Preferred Stock,  subject to certain dividend restrictions.
2.  The underwriting agreement for the Series J Preferred Stock offering, dated March 3, 2025, involved six underwriters and a purchase price of $990.00 per depositary share.
3. The issuance of the Series J Preferred Stock includes restrictions on dividends paid to common stockholders if dividends are not paid to Series J Preferred Stock holders for the preceding period.
1. Applied Materials Inc.'s annual shareholder meeting on March 6, 2025, resulted in the election of ten director nominees, each for a one-year term.
2.  Shareholder approval, on an advisory basis, was granted for the compensation of the Company’s named executive officers for fiscal year 2024.
3. KPMG LLP was ratified as the company's independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2025.
1. On March 10, 2025, PayPal Holdings, Inc. appointed Joy Chik, President of Identity and Network Access at Microsoft, to its Board of Directors, increasing the board size from 11 to 12 members.
2.  Ms. Chik's appointment fills a vacancy created by the expansion of the board.
3.  Ms. Chik's expertise in AI and cybersecurity will help guide PayPal's strategic shift to a full-stack commerce API.

1. On March 10, 2025, IQVIA Holdings Inc. amended its Credit Agreement to refinance $1,985,000,000 in debt, lowering the interest rate on a portion of its borrowings from SOFR plus 2.00% to SOFR plus 1.75%.
2.  The amendment to the Credit Agreement involved a refinancing of $1,985,000,000 in Term B loans.
3. The amendment's effectiveness was contingent on multiple conditions being met by March 10, 2025, including receipt of legal opinions and corporate documentation.

1. On March 6, 2025, Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. (PSEG) completed a public offering of $1 billion in senior notes, comprised of $600 million in 4.900% notes due 2030 and $400 million in 5.400% notes due 2035.
2.  The offering generated $992,914,000 in aggregate proceeds to PSEG before expenses.
3. The notes are governed by an indenture dated November 1, 1998, and the offering was made pursuant to a registration statement filed in November 13, 2023.
1. Delta Air Lines significantly lowered its Q1 2025 earnings per share projection to $0.30-$0.50 from an initial projection of $0.70-$1.00, due to weaker-than-expected demand.
2.  Delta's Trainer refinery faces potential uninsured liabilities exceeding $50 million.
3.  Delta projects a 15-20% year-over-year increase in fuel costs for Q1 2025.
1. On March 7, 2025, Chubb Ltd. completed a share capital reduction of CHF 3,759,282.50 by cancelling 7,518,565 treasury shares.
2.  Chubb Ltd.'s share capital decreased from CHF 209,812,993 to CHF 206,053,710.50, reflecting the cancellation of treasury shares.
3.  Chubb Ltd.'s Board of Directors has authorization to change share capital until May 16, 2025, within a range of CHF 167,850,394.50 to CHF 251,775,591.50.

1. As of March 7, 2025, EQT Corporation had received sufficient consents to amend the indentures governing all its outstanding EQM Midstream Partners, LP notes except for the 5.500% Senior Notes due 2028.
2.  By March 7, 2025, 79.0% of EQT's outstanding 3.900% Senior Notes due 2027 and 56.2% of EQM's outstanding 6.500% Senior Notes due 2027 were validly tendered.

3.  EQT Corporation expects to make payments for accepted notes on March 12, 2025, contingent on the fulfillment of various conditions outlined in the Offer to Purchase and Consent Solicitation Statement.

1. Elevance Health reaffirmed its 2025 shareholders' earnings guidance of $30.40 to $31.10 per diluted share, which includes approximately $3.75 per diluted share of net unfavorable items; excluding these items, adjusted earnings are expected to be $34.15 to $34.85 per diluted share.
2.  Elevance Health expects 2025 year-end total medical enrollment to be consistent with its Q4 2024 guidance, including Medicare Advantage membership of 2.2 to 2.25 million members.

3. The company identified several future risks, including trends in healthcare costs and utilization, reduced enrollment, the impact of large-scale medical emergencies, and the impact of changes in laws and regulations.

1. Nike, Inc. entered into two new credit agreements on March 7, 2025, a 364-day credit facility for up to $1 billion (expandable to $1.5 billion) and a five-year credit facility for up to $2 billion (expandable to $3 billion).

2.  Nike terminated its prior 364-day credit agreement ($1 billion) and its prior five-year credit agreement ($2 billion) on March 7, 2025, with no outstanding amounts on either facility at the time of termination.

3. The new five-year credit agreement has a maturity date of March 7, 2030, extendable up to two one-year periods, while the 364-day credit agreement matures on March 6, 2026, potentially extendable by a further 364 days.
1. Oracle's Q3 2025 Remaining Performance Obligations (RPO) reached a record $130 billion, a 62% increase year-over-year in USD and 63% in constant currency.
2.  Oracle's Q3 2025 GAAP earnings per share increased by 20% year-over-year to $1.02, while non-GAAP earnings per share increased by 4% to $1.47.
3. Oracle projects a 15% increase in overall revenue for fiscal year 2026 (beginning June 2025), driven by its large sales backlog.

1. On March 10, 2025, CME Group Inc. completed a $750,000,000 public offering of 4.400% Notes due 2030, intending to use the proceeds to redeem its outstanding 3.00% notes due 2025 and for general corporate purposes.
2.  The 4.400% Notes due 2030 were offered at 99.573% of their principal amount, with interest payable semi-annually starting September 15, 2025.

3. The Indenture governing the Notes includes covenants restricting CME Group's ability to incur certain liens, engage in sale and leaseback transactions, and undertake significant asset transfers,  triggering a repurchase offer at 101% of principal plus accrued interest if a change of control occurs.
1. On March 10, 2025, Exelon Corporation appointed David DeWalt, a cybersecurity expert, to its Board of Directors.
2. The 8-K filing indicates that Exelon Corporation serves 10.7 million customers.
3.  David DeWalt's appointment to Exelon's Board is intended to enhance the safety of Exelon's operations and customer data in a rapidly evolving technological landscape.

1. On March 10, 2025, Domino's Pizza Inc. promoted Joseph H. Jordan to Chief Operating Officer and President – Domino’s U.S., with an annual base salary of $700,000 and a potential bonus of 150% of his base salary.
2. Domino's Pizza Inc. reported global retail sales of over $19.1 billion in 2024.
3.  If Mr. Jordan's employment is terminated without cause or he leaves for good reason, he will receive 12 months of his current annual base salary in severance.
1. On March 4, 2025, Hershey Company amended its bylaws to require the Chairman of the Board to be an independent director, unless the CEO also holds the Chairman position.
2. The bylaws now implement a majority voting standard for uncontested director elections, requiring any director receiving more votes against than for their election to offer their resignation.
3.  The Board of Directors will decide within 90 days whether to accept any resignation tendered under the new majority voting standard, and will file a Form 8-K disclosing their decision.
1. CSX Corp completed a public offering of $600,000,000 of 5.050% Notes due 2035 on March 10, 2025.
2. The offering was made pursuant to a shelf registration statement on Form S-3ASR (Registration No. 333-285319), which became effective February 27, 2025.
3.  Legal opinions on the validity of the Notes were provided by Davis Polk & Wardwell LLP and Hunton Andrews Kurth LLP, filed as exhibits.
1. Sherwin-Williams amended its credit agreement to extend the maturity date of $75,000,000 in borrowing commitments from June 20, 2025, to June 20, 2030.
2.  Certain lenders and their affiliates provide Sherwin-Williams with various financial services and receive customary fees.
3. The amendment to the credit agreement became effective on March 10, 2025, contingent upon the Administrative Agent receiving signed counterparts and verification of representations and warranties.
1. At the March 4, 2025, annual meeting, Nordson Corp. shareholders elected three new directors to serve until 2028, and one new director to serve until 2026.
2.  92.86% of Nordson Corp.'s outstanding shares were represented at the March 4, 2025 annual meeting.
3. Victor L. Richey, Jr. was elected chair of the Board of Directors, effective March 4, 2025.
1. News Corp announced a daily buy-back notification on March 10, 2025, reporting the repurchase of 31,617,184 shares of Class A and Class B common stock, totaling approximately US$645,729,344.63.
2. As of March 7, 2025, News Corp had already repurchased approximately US$645,729,344.63 worth of Class A and Class B shares under its US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
3. News Corp's stock repurchase program, authorized to acquire up to US$1 billion of its outstanding shares, is ongoing and subject to market conditions and other factors.
1. On March 7, 2025, Progressive Corp appointed Carl G. Joyce as Vice President and Chief Accounting Officer, replacing Mariann Wojtkun Marshall.
2. The filing is an 8-K Current Report, indicating a significant event requiring immediate disclosure to the SEC.
3. No specific future impacts or risks are mentioned numerically in this section of the filing.
1. ServiceNow announced on March 10, 2025, a definitive agreement to acquire Moveworks for $2.85 billion, with the closing expected in the second half of 2025.
2. ServiceNow's Pro Plus AI solution surpassed $200 million in annual contract value (ACV) as of December 31, 2024.
3.  The acquisition of Moveworks presents risks including challenges in integration, regulatory approvals, and potential disruption to Moveworks' business operations.

1. CrowdStrike's net income dramatically decreased from $89.33 million in fiscal year 2024 to a net loss of $19.27 million in fiscal year 2025, primarily due to a July 19, 2024, incident resulting in significant legal and professional service expenses.
2.  The company's dollar-based net retention rate dropped from 119% in fiscal year 2024 to 112% in fiscal year 2025.
3. Despite the net loss, CrowdStrike increased its cash equivalents to $4.0 billion as of January 31, 2025, from $3.1 billion a year prior.

1. John O. Larsen will retire as Chairman of the Board of Alliant Energy Corporation, Interstate Power & Light Company, and Wisconsin Power & Light Company after the 2025 Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
2. Patrick E. Allen, a board member since 2011, has been designated as the new Board Chair, effective after the 2025 Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
3. This 8-K filing, dated March 7, 2025, reports the departure of a director and the appointment of a new chair; no other significant developments or risks are mentioned.
1. On March 6th, 2025, DexCom, Inc. appointed Renée Galá as a director to its eleven-member board.
2. Ms. Galá received an initial equity grant of restricted stock units (RSUs) valued at $500,000, vesting annually over three years, plus a pro-rata annual grant of RSUs worth $56,986.
3.  A change in control of DexCom would trigger full and immediate vesting of outstanding equity awards held by non-employee directors.
1. Cincinnati Financial's 2024 Property and Casualty premium growth of 13% significantly exceeded its 15-year CAGR of 8%.
2.  The company's 2024 combined ratio was 96.5%, which included $26 million in net unfavorable reserve development.
3.  Cincinnati Financial projected a 6% to 10% increase in Property and Casualty premiums for 2025,  a prediction made in March 2022.
1. Diamondback Energy, Inc. entered into an Underwriting Agreement on March 6, 2025, to issue $1,200,000,000 of 5.550% Senior Notes due 2035, with an expected closing on March 20, 2025.
2. The net proceeds from the note sale are expected to be approximately $1.19 billion,  a portion of which will fund the pending acquisition of Double Eagle subsidiaries.
3.  The Underwriting Agreement includes customary representations, warranties, covenants, indemnification, and contribution provisions.
1. Emerson Electric Co. extended the deadline for its tender offer to acquire Aspen Technology, Inc. to 5:00 p.m., Eastern Time on March 11, 2025.
2.  The initial tender offer price was $265 per share.

3. The acquisition is subject to several conditions, including at least a majority of AspenTech's outstanding shares being tendered, and the possibility of competing offers or government intervention poses risks to the transaction's completion.
1. On March 7, 2025, Cardinal Health, Inc. added Robert Musslewhite and Sudhakar Ramakrishna to its Board of Directors.
2.  Both new board members have extensive experience leading technology companies; Musslewhite in healthcare and Ramakrishna in broader technology.
3.  The compensation for the new directors will be consistent with that of other non-employee directors, as detailed in the company's 2024 Schedule 14A proxy statement.
1. Insulet Corporation and NXP USA, Inc. amended their Purchase Agreement on March 7, 2025, extending its term and modifying pricing, volume, warranties, and product modifications.
2.  The amendment, effective January 1, 2025, covers purchases from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2025, with purchase orders already placed for the first two quarters of 2025.
3.  Significant portions of the Addendum to the Purchase Agreement are redacted as confidential, limiting the full understanding of the agreement's details.

1. Cencora, Inc. raised its fiscal year 2025 adjusted diluted earnings per share (EPS) guidance from $15.25 to $15.55 to $15.30 to $15.60, as of March 10, 2025, citing continued momentum in its core U.S. Healthcare Solutions segment.
2. This updated guidance, released on March 10, 2025, does not reflect any change in expectations for the recently completed acquisition of Retina Consultants of America.

3.  The company's  March 10, 2025 filing states that a reconciliation of the non-GAAP financial measure to the most comparable GAAP financial measure is not provided on a forward-looking basis due to the difficulty of accurately estimating reconciling items.
